timeline.bodyText:
please add inner class
as detected at https://checkstyle-diff-reports.s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/googlestyle-rule73_2020140754/reports/diff/apache-jsecurity/index.html#A6
please add inner class to correct InputMissingJavadocTypeCheckNoViolations.java also.
timeline.author: romani

timeline.bodyText:
please place public enum, inteface without javadoc ... to clearly state it is not required.
I do believe it is mistake in style but we need to wait until it is resolved in style first.
timeline.author: romani
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,8 @@
+package com.google.checkstyle.test.chapter7javadoc.rule73wherejavadocrequired;
+
+/**
+ * This is a Javadoc comment.
+ */
+public class InputMissingJavadocTypeCheckNoViolations { // OK

replies.bodyText:
From https://google.github.io/styleguide/javaguide.html#s1.1-terminology:
"The term class is used inclusively to mean an "ordinary" class, enum class, interface or annotation type (@interface)."
From https://google.github.io/styleguide/javaguide.html#s7.3-javadoc-where-required:
"At the minimum, Javadoc is present for every public class, and every public or protected member of such a class, with a few exceptions noted below."
Therefore, google style dictates that we should use the default tokens for this check.  I am reworking this PR to reflect this.
replies.author: nmancus1

replies.bodyText: So we need to add corresponding tokens in config
replies.author: romani

timeline.bodyText: It is better to remove javadoc to clearly show that  only public is valudated
timeline.author: romani
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,72 @@
+package com.google.checkstyle.test.chapter7javadoc.rule73wherejavadocrequired;
+
+/**
+ * This is a Javadoc comment.
+ */
+public class InputMissingJavadocTypeCheckNoViolations { // OK
+
+    /**
+     * This is a Javadoc comment.
+     */
+    public class Inner implements MyInterface{ // OK
+
+    }
+
+    /**
+     * This is a Javadoc comment.
+     */
+    public enum MyEnum { // OK
+
+    }
+
+    /**
+     * This is a Javadoc comment.
+     */
+    public interface MyInterface {  // OK
+
+        /**
+         * This is a Javadoc comment.
+         */
+        class MyInterfaceClass {}  // OK
+    }
+
+    /**
+     * This is a Javadoc comment.
+     */
+    public @interface MyAnnotation { // OK
+
+    }
+
+    /**
+     * This is a Javadoc comment.
+     */
+    protected class InnerProtected { // OK

replies.bodyText: Protected is too, if it is within a public class; this is why I've added the javadoc here.
replies.author: nmancus1

timeline.bodyText:
Why protected ?
Can you quote a guide?

Please add private and package-private fields
Package-private are very similar to protected to some extent.
